articles.title: Signal’s first paid feature adds encrypted media and message backups
articles.description: Signal is launching its first paid feature: the ability to make secure, end-to-end encrypted backups of your media history older than 45 days and of your text message history for $1.99 per month. “Media requires a lot of storage, and storing and transferring large amounts of data is expensive,” Sign
articles.content: Signal is launching its first paid feature: the ability to make secure, end-to-end encrypted backups of your media history older than 45 days and of your text message history for $1.99 per month. “Media requires a lot of storage, and storing and transferring large amounts of data is expensive,” Signal’s VP of engineering, Jim O’Leary, says in a blog post . “As a nonprofit that refuses to collect or sell your data, Signal needs to cover those costs differently than other tech organizations that o
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.description: Google is opening up AI Mode to more languages. Starting today, the AI chatbot the company is integrating into Google Search is available in Hindi, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean and Brazilian Portuguese. The company has been rapidly expanding access to the search experience. In May, Google started of
articles.content: Google is opening up AI Mode to more languages. Starting today, the AI chatbot the company is integrating into Google Search is available in Hindi, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean and Brazilian Portuguese. The company has been rapidly expanding access to the search experience. In May, Google started offering it to everyone in the US (and later the UK and India) after starting public tests just two months earlier. Google added more features to AI Mode in July, including support for the Gemini 2.5 Pr
articles.author: Kris Holt

This post walks through how I deployed distilbert-base-uncased-finetuned-sst-2-english using: 🧠 Hugging Fa
articles.content: Deploying a Sentiment Analysis Model with FastAPI and Docker 🚀 You’ve trained a machine learning model. ✅ It works on your test set. ✅ And now... you want to make it useful in the real world. This post walks through how I deployed distilbert-base-uncased-finetuned-sst-2-english using: 🧠 Hugging Face transformers ⚡ FastAPI + Uvicorn 📦 Docker (multi-stage build!) The result is an API that can analyze sentimentin real time or in batches with health checks, usage metrics, and a production-ready c

articles.description: Cefalo is the founder of Space DOTs, which launched in 2022 to detect space threats. She and her team have created a software platform for space tech manufacturers and operators to help them capture various data points, like radiation interference, as well as track any in-orbit anomalies, to help ma
articles.content: Cefalo is the founder of Space DOTs, which launched in 2022 to detect space threats. She and her team have created a software platform for space tech manufacturers and operators to help them capture various data points, like radiation interference, as well as track any in-orbit anomalies, to help make space travel safer.

articles.content: The arrival of September means it's officially iPhone season. And tomorrow, Apple is finally going to showcase its latest iPhone 17 lineup , allowing us to separate fact from rumor once and for all. Apple has dubbed the upcoming event " Awe dropping ," so we're hoping for several big announcements that'll warrant the tagline. The debut begins on September 9 at 1PM ET/10AM PT. If you want to tune in to hear what Tim Cook and crew have to say about the presumed iPhone 17, you can strea

articles.description: Amazon Music has just launched new AI-powered weekly playlists based on the "preferences and mood" of listeners. This just means it scrapes what you've already been listening to and extrapolates further. It doesn't apply modern technology to gauge the actual mood of users. The company says t
articles.content: Amazon Music has just launched new AI-powered weekly playlists based on the "preferences and mood" of listeners. This just means it scrapes what you've already been listening to and extrapolates further. It doesn't apply modern technology to gauge the actual mood of users. The company says the playlists include "a curated mix of familiar favorites from their most listened-to artists and latest favorites to new discoveries." I'm not exactly sure how this is different from what music s
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: On a day of rebranding at the Pentagon, this name change slipped under the radar
articles.description: We'll see how long the Department of War lasts. Space Force Combat Forces Command might stick around.
articles.content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Friday authorizing the Department of Defense to refer to itself as the Department of War, reverting to a more bellicose title used until a 1940s-era military shakeup in the aftermath of World War II. The order approves the Pentagon's use of the Department of War name as an "additional secondary title" for the Department of Defense while the Trump administration seeks congressional approval to officially change the name. Until Congress votes on the

articles.title: Cómo hackear tu seniority en IT (sin aprender otro framework)
articles.description: Introducción Cuando empecé a acercarme al mundo IT, todo me resultaba abrumador: lenguajes, frameworks, paradigmas, herramientas… parecía un universo infinito. En el año 2018/2019, quise aprender a programar en Python, y me encontré con cursos sobre Python y Python3 🤯. ¿Si quiero aprender python te
articles.content: Introducción Cuando empecé a acercarme al mundo IT, todo me resultaba abrumador: lenguajes, frameworks, paradigmas, herramientas… parecía un universo infinito. En el año 2018/2019, quise aprender a programar en Python, y me encontré con cursos sobre Python y Python3 🤯. ¿Si quiero aprender python tengo que ir 1 por 1? ¿Es como una saga de películas? ¿Puedo empezar por el 3 o me va a faltar lore más adelante? 🤔. Parece chiste pero es anécdota: tuve que consultar con un amigo con cuál empezar 😅.
articles.author: Lautaro Celli

articles.title: From Readable to Lightweight: Understanding JSON Minification
articles.description: JSON has become one of the most widely used data formats for web applications, APIs, and configuration files. Its human-readable structure makes it easy to work with, but sometimes that readability comes at a cost. Larger file sizes can slow down loading times and increase bandwidth usage. That is w
articles.content: JSON has become one of the most widely used data formats for web applications, APIs, and configuration files. Its human-readable structure makes it easy to work with, but sometimes that readability comes at a cost. Larger file sizes can slow down loading times and increase bandwidth usage. That is where JSON minification comes in. What is JSON Minification? JSON minification is the process of removing unnecessary characters from a JSON file without changing its data. This usually includes: White

articles.title: Benoit Blanc goes full Gothic in Wake Up Dead Man trailer
articles.description: "To understand this case, we need to look around the myth that's being constructed."
articles.content: Private detective Benoit Blanc (Daniel Craig) might just turn out to be Rian Johnson's greatest creation. Introduced in 2019's Knives Out , Blanc's syrupy Southern drawl and idiosyncratic approach to solving a mysterious New England death charmed audiences worldwide and launched a modern whodunnit franchise . The third installment in the series, Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery , has already garnered early rave reviews after screening at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) over
articles.author: Jennifer Ouellette

articles.title: Vodafone is testing an AI 'actor' to sell its products instead of paying a human to do it
articles.description: Vodafone made a commercial starring an AI avatar posing as a real lady. This is interesting because Vodafone is a major global brand and not a fly-by-night TikTok company using a ridiculous deepfake of Jackson Galaxy to sell cat toys. The tells in the commercial are obvious and what one would expect
articles.content: Vodafone made a commercial starring an AI avatar posing as a real lady. This is interesting because Vodafone is a major global brand and not a fly-by-night TikTok company using a ridiculous deepfake of Jackson Galaxy to sell cat toys. The tells in the commercial are obvious and what one would expect. The AI avatar's hair is a bit off, which ruins the charade that this is a real person. The physical mannerisms and speaking tone are also wonky. A facial mole moves around at one point. It's
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology . Every year, we recognize 35 such individuals from around the world—all of whom are under the age of 35. These scientists, inventors, and entrepreneurs are working to help mitigate climate chang
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams

articles.title: Why basic science deserves our boldest investment
articles.description: In December 1947, three physicists at Bell Telephone Laboratories—John Bardeen, William Shockley, and Walter Brattain—built a compact electronic device using thin gold wires and a piece of germanium, a material known as a semiconductor. Their invention, later named the transistor (for which they wer
articles.content: In December 1947, three physicists at Bell Telephone Laboratories—John Bardeen, William Shockley, and Walter Brattain—built a compact electronic device using thin gold wires and a piece of germanium, a material known as a semiconductor. Their invention, later named the transistor (for which they were awarded the Nobel Prize in 1956 ), could amplify and switch electrical signals, marking a dramatic departure from the bulky and fragile vacuum tubes that had powered electronics until then. Its inve
articles.author: Julia R. Greer

articles.title: Gemini app finally expands to audio files
articles.description: Google made three major updates to its Gemini-powered products on Monday: The Gemini app now accepts audio files; Search can handle five new languages; and NotebookLM creates reports in the form of blog posts, study guides, quizzes, and more.  According to a Monday post on X by Josh Woodward, v
articles.content: Google made three major updates to its Gemini-powered products on Monday: The Gemini app now accepts audio files; Search can handle five new languages; and NotebookLM creates reports in the form of blog posts, study guides, quizzes, and more. According to a Monday post on X by Josh Woodward, vice president of Google Labs and Gemini, audio file compatibility was the “#1 request” to the Gemini app. Free Gemini users max out at 10 minutes of audio, and five free prompts each day. AI Pro or AI Ultra
articles.author: Elissa Welle

articles.title: The Polestar 5 is an 884hp fastback sedan that should make Porsche nervous
articles.description: It’s been five years since Polestar first introduced the Precept, a concept car that the electric automaker described as “a manifesto of things to come; a declaration.” Well, come they have, because today Polestar finally revealed the production car that’s based on this manifesto: the Polestar 5. An
articles.content: It’s been five years since Polestar first introduced the Precept , a concept car that the electric automaker described as “a manifesto of things to come; a declaration.” Well, come they have, because today Polestar finally revealed the production car that’s based on this manifesto : the Polestar 5. And wow, these specs: up to 460 miles of range, 800-volt architecture for ultra-fast charging, 884 horsepower, 0–60mph in an oomph-inducing 3.1 seconds for the Performance trim. It certainly makes tho
articles.author: Andrew J. Hawkins

articles.title: The best budget smartphone you can buy
articles.description: Some of us take a kind of “I eat to live” rather than an “I live to eat” approach to gadgets. They’re tools that help you get things done, not something you want to invest a lot of time or money in. If that’s you — and there’s no judgment here from a certifiable gadget […]
articles.content: You can get a great budget device these days if you know how to pick your priorities. | Image: The Verge Some of us take a kind of “I eat to live” rather than an “I live to eat” approach to gadgets. They’re tools that help you get things done, not something you want to invest a lot of time or money in. If that’s you — and there’s no judgment here from a certifiable gadget nerd — then you can probably think of more worthwhile ways to spend $1,000 than on a phone. Budget phones to the rescue. Thes
articles.author: Allison Johnson

articles.title: EchoStar to sell spectrum to SpaceX after FCC threatened to revoke licenses
articles.description: Starlink says $17 billion spectrum purchase will improve its cellphone service.
articles.content: SpaceX's complaints to the Federal Communications Commission have helped the satellite company land a $17 billion deal to buy spectrum licenses from EchoStar. The deal consists of up to $8.5 billion in cash and up to $8.5 billion in SpaceX stock, EchoStar said. SpaceX also agreed to pay $2 billion worth of interest payments on EchoStar debt through November 2027. After SpaceX alleged that EchoStar subsidiary Dish Network "barely uses" its spectrum and urged the FCC to make the spectrum available
articles.author: Jon Brodkin

articles.title: The Polestar 5 electric sedan makes its world debut
articles.description: The electric grand tourer charges fast, accelerates even faster.
articles.content: Today, Polestar debuted its newest model. Just as three is followed by four , next in the series comes five—in this case the Polestar 5. And the new EV is a little departure from the products we've seen so far from this Swedish/Chinese startup. It's a handsome if angular sedan that, like the Polestar 4 SUV, eschews a rear window in favor of more headroom for passengers and a rear-view camera. "Polestar 5 is bringing the future to our present. Our vision for Polestar's design, technology, and sus
articles.author: Jonathan M. Gitlin
